exceptions.tactic: apply classic in H as [HP | HNP].
exceptions.exn: Unable to apply lemma of type "forall P : Prop, P \\/ ~ P" on hypothesis of type "P = (~ P)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall P : Prop, P <> (~ P)

Premises:
ClassicalFacts.wp2p2 : forall (or : Prop -> Prop -> Prop) (or_introl : forall A B : Prop, A -> or A B) (or_intror : forall A B : Prop, B -> or A B) (or_elim : forall A B C : Prop, (A -> C) -> (B -> C) -> or A B -> C), (forall (A B C : Prop) (f : A -> C) (g : B -> C) (b : B), g b = or_elim A B C f g (or_intror A B b)) -> (forall (A B : Prop) (P : or A B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (or_introl A B a)) -> (forall b : B, P (or_intror A B b)) -> forall b : or A B, P b) ->...-> Hurkens.NoRetractToNegativeProp.El A
Decidable.dec_not_not : forall P : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> (~ P -> False) -> P
ChoiceFacts.constructive_definite_descr_excluded_middle : (forall A : Type, ChoiceFacts.ConstructiveDefiniteDescription_on A) -> (forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P) -> forall P : Prop, {P} + {~ P}
ChoiceFacts.fun_reification_descr_computational_excluded_middle_in_prop_context : (forall A B : Type, ChoiceFacts.FunctionalRelReification_on A B) -> (forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P) -> forall C : Prop, ((forall P : Prop, {P} + {~ P}) -> C) -> C
Decidable.dec_not : forall A : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> Decidable.decidable (~ A)
ClassicalFacts.p2p1 : forall (or : Prop -> Prop -> Prop) (or_introl : forall A B : Prop, A -> or A B) (or_intror : forall A B : Prop, B -> or A B) (or_elim : forall A B C : Prop, (A -> C) -> (B -> C) -> or A B -> C), (forall (A B C : Prop) (f : A -> C) (g : B -> C) (a : A), f a = or_elim A B C f g (or_introl A B a)) -> (forall (A B : Prop) (P : or A B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (or_introl A B a)) -> (forall b : B, P (or_intror A B b)) -> forall b : or A B, P b) ->...-> b1 = or_elim A (~ A) B (fun _ : A => b1) (fun _ : ~ A => b2) (em A)
ssrbool.xorPif : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> Q \/ P -> ~ (Q /\ P) -> if b then ~ Q else Q
ssrbool.xorPifn : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P (negb b) -> Q \/ P -> ~ (Q /\ P) -> if b then Q else ~ Q
classic : forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P
Bool.ReflectT : forall P : Prop, P -> Bool.reflect P true
Bool.ReflectF : forall P : Prop, ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false
ChoiceFacts.ExcludedMiddle = forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P : Prop
ssrbool.classicP : forall P : Prop, ssrbool.classically P < -> ~ ~ P
DecidableDec.decidable_dec : forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P -> {P} + {~ P}
ssreflect.iffLRn : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> ~ P -> ~ Q
ssrbool.impliesPn : forall P Q : Prop, ssrbool.implies P Q -> ~ Q -> ~ P
not_imply_elim : forall P Q : Prop, ~ (P -> Q) -> P
ssrbool.equivPif : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> (Q -> P) -> (P -> Q) -> if b then Q else ~ Q
ssrbool.equivPifn : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P (negb b) -> (Q -> P) -> (P -> Q) -> if b then ~ Q else Q
imply_to_or : forall P Q : Prop, (P -> Q) -> ~ P \/ Q
imply_to_and : forall P Q : Prop, ~ (P -> Q) -> P /\ ~ Q
decide_left : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : C, P (left H)) -> P decide
decide_right : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), ~ C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : ~ C, P (right H)) -> P decide
DecidableDec.classic_dec : forall P : Prop, {P} + {~ P}
DecidableDec.exclusive_dec : forall P Q : Prop, ~ (P /\ Q) -> P \/ Q -> {P} + {Q}
ChoiceFacts.ConstructiveDefiniteDescription_on = fun A : Type => forall P : A -> Prop, (exists ! x : A, P x) -> {x : A | P x} : Type -> Type Arguments ChoiceFacts.ConstructiveDefiniteDescription_on _%type_scope
not_imply_elim2 : forall P Q : Prop, ~ (P -> Q) -> ~ Q
Field_theory.FExpr_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Field_theory.FExpr C -> Prop), P Field_theory.FEO -> P Field_theory.FEI -> (forall c : C, P (Field_theory.FEc c)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (Field_theory.FEX C p)) -> (forall f3 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f3 -> forall f4 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f4 -> P (Field_theory.FEadd f3 f4)) -> (forall f4 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f4 -> forall f5 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f5 -> P (Field_theory.FEsub f4 f5)) -> (forall f5 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f5 -> forall f6 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f6 -> P (Field_theory.FEmul f5 f6)) ->...-> forall f10 : Field_theory.FExpr C, P f10
Ring_polynom.PExpr_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop), P Ring_polynom.PEO -> P Ring_polynom.PEI -> (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.PEc c)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (Ring_polynom.PEX C p)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEadd p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEsub p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEmul p p0)) ->...-> forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l

```coq
intros P H.
apply classic in H as [HP | HNP].
- contradiction.
- apply H. intro HP. contradiction.
Qed.
```

original: intros P H. apply classic in H as [HP | HNP]. - contradiction. - apply H. intro HP. contradiction.
